It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia, including India, Sri Lanka, and Indonesia. The plant has small, elliptical leaves that are often clustered at the base of the stem, and it produces small, white or pale yellow flowers. Its fruits are berries that contain a single seed, and it relies on birds for seed dispersal. Ophiorrhiza seriata is often found growing on the branches of host trees, forming dense clusters that can affect the host's growth.
